data.label:
Narrator

A storm was on the horizon outside my window.

Narrator

The mood in my office was equally dark and a storm of a different kind was brewing inside.

Narrator

And a storm of a different kind was brewing inside my office.

Narrator

The mood in my office was equally dark, despite the news of the governor's release by the BFF.

Narrator

I straightened myself on the sofa and looked at Karl, who was sitting on the couch across from me, ready to give me the report from the Soll Dam.

Narrator

And a storm of a different kind was brewing inside my office.

Narrator

Suddenly, we heard a knock on the door and Lucian entered.

Narrator

And a storm of a different kind was brewing inside my office.

Narrator

Inside my office, however, was very warm and cosy.

Narrator

Suddenly, we heard a knock on the door and Lucian entered.

Lucian Galade

"Sir."

Lucian Galade

"Great. Then we must go to the meeting room, sir. One of our new campaign advisors has some plans for the election. He's waiting for us."

Narrator

And a storm of a different kind was brewing inside my office.

Karl Greiser

"Thanks to the well-planned operation of the Secret State Police, we suffered zero casualties."

Karl Greiser

"Sir. The operation has been completed with a large number of casualties. The rebels used explosives to destroy the power station at the dam."

Karl Greiser

"Unfortunately, the damage of the explosion has rendered the dam useless. The electricity has been cut."

Narrator

He puffed himself up.

Karl Greiser

"At this very moment, our special teams are raiding numerous suspected BFF hideouts to find the smaller groups before they can reorganize."

Karl Greiser

"Also, one of the rebels who died at the operation was identified to be their current leader. We'll soon eradicate their group completely, Mr. President, have no worries."

Narrator

I straightened myself on the sofa and looked at Karl. He was sitting on the couch across from me, ready to give me a report about an "incident". I had just learned that a policeman gunned down an entire crowd.

Narrator

I straightened myself on the sofa, raised my head and looked at Karl. He was sitting on the couch across from me, ready to give me a report about the operations of the police.

Player

"Great work Karl."

Player

"How the hell did you let this happen?"

Karl Greiser

"I'm sorry, sir. We couldn't get to him in time."

Player

"Mistakes happen..."

Player

"Let's not ponder over it too much. We can't reverse time."

Player

"Can you ever do your job properly!?"

Karl Greiser

"I know there is no excuse for it, sir. But I will make sure nothing like this ever happens again."

Player

"Good. Then get to work immediately."

Player

"I suggest you start packing up your things."

Player

"You heard me. Now get out."

Narrator

He stood up immediately and left the room without saying a word.

Narrator

He stood up, bowed and left the room.

Player

"How the hell did you let this happen?"

Player

"How many are we talking about, Karl?"

Narrator

He lowered his head.

Player

"I told you to establish talks with them, not shoot the entire crowd down!"

Karl Greiser

"Thank you, sir."

Player

"Great work Karl."

Player

"How the hell did you let this happen?"

Narrator

He puffed himself up.

Karl Greiser

"I'm sorry, sir."

Karl Greiser

"The community police personnel at the scene has helped immensely with the operations by convincing the peaceful protesters to work with them to catch the armed militants hiding among them."

Narrator

He lowered his head for a moment.

Karl Greiser

"Sir. Our operations are still ongoing. Unfortunately there have been casualties from both sides."

Player

"This is your last chance, Karl."

Player

"Go pack up your office. You are dismissed."

Karl Greiser

"Sir?"

Player

"You must bring the situation under control immediately."

Karl Greiser

"That's all for now, sir."

Karl Greiser

"Sir. The operations have been successful. The riots and the armed militants have been dealt with, and the protests have been broken up for the time being."

Player

"Make sure such an incident like this never happens again."

Player

"Goddamit Karl!"

Narrator

He stood up, bowed and left the room.

Karl Greiser

"I'll get going."

Player

"You said that after Circas' murder too."

Player

"I suggest you start packing up your things."

Narrator

He stood up immediately and left the room without saying a word.

Player

"Good. Then get to work immediately."

Karl Greiser

"Yes, sir!"

Player

"Goddam-it Karl!"

Player

"This is your last chance, Karl."

Player

"Go pack up your office. You are dismissed."

Player

"I said YOU ARE FIRED!"

Player

"I suggest you start packing up your things."

Karl Greiser

"Sir. I know you wanted to stop the protests... But these people do not respect the police."

Karl Greiser

"These are not innocent *citizens* anymore, Mr. President. They are a mob. And so one of our boys had a reaction under stress..."

Player

"I told you to bring the situation under control, not shoot the entire crowd down!"

Player

"How the hell did you let this happen?"

Iosef Lancea

"With the authorization you gave us, the Sordish Armed Forces have assumed direct control of the Bergia region for the purposes of eliminating the enemies of the state, and bringing stability back to Sordland."

Iosef Lancea

"Mr. President. The BFF forces at Soll Dam have been eliminated. We have discovered and destroyed three hidden bases of operations."

Karl Greiser

"Sir. The operation has been successful. The governor has been taken out of the dam unharmed and the armed rebels at the scene were eliminated."

Narrator

I straightened myself on the sofa and looked at Iosef, who was sitting on the couch across from me. He was here to give me a report about the military operations.

Narrator

I straightened myself on the sofa and looked at Iosef. He was sitting on the couch across from me, here to give me a report about the military operations.

Iosef Lancea

"The hunt for the militants continues. Hundreds of armed rebels have already been eliminated and thousands of firearms captured."

Player

"Great work, Iosef. When will it be over?"

Player

"The army is playing with fire. You cannot just assume control. Call off your men immediately."

Iosef Lancea

"The army will clear the enemies as ordered, and will not back down until the order is completed. This will take as long as it has to, Mr. President."

Player

"I understand. Keep me updated."

Player

"Are you defying my orders, Iosef?"

Iosef Lancea

"Of course."

Player

"I can have you dismissed for this."

Player

"That was not my order."

Iosef Lancea

"No, sir. The army is doing exactly as you asked. You called the Armed Forces to Bergia to stabilize the situation..."

Iosef Lancea

"I believe that is up to the *new* General Staff, sir."

Iosef Lancea

"There is no need to doubt the Forces, sir."

Narrator

He stood up and walked up to my desk.

Narrator

He left the office before I could even reply.

Player

"The army is playing with fire. You cannot just take control. Call off your men immediately."

Player

"Assumed direct control? What is the meaning of this!?"

Player

"I'm giving you another order now. Pull the forces back from Nargis."

Iosef Lancea

"With the authorization you gave us, the Sordish Armed Forces has assumed direct control of the Nargis region for the purposes of eliminating the enemies of the state, and bringing stability back to Sordland."

Iosef Lancea

"Mr. President. The army has neutralized about a hundred armed militants in the regions of Bergia and Nargis."

Iosef Lancea

"The hunt continues. Hundreds of armed rebels have already been eliminated and thousands of firearms captured."

Player

"I can have you dismissed for this."

Narrator

He left the office before I could even reply.

Player

"I understand. Keep me updated."

Player

"Great work, Iosef. When will it be over?"

Iosef Lancea

"I must leave now, sir. The General Staff requested me. I'll keep you updated."

Player

"Are you defying my orders, Iosef?"

Player

"I really doubt that."

Iosef Lancea

"After carefully evaluating the situation, the General Staff decided that the army cannot simply pull back yet. We are only acting on your orders, Mr. President."

Iosef Lancea

"The army is only acting for the interests of the Sordish people and the security of the state."

Iosef Lancea

"The army will clear the enemies as ordered, and will not back down until the order is completed. This will take as long as it has to, Mr. President."

Iosef Lancea

"The situation is not yet stabilised."

Iosef Lancea

"I believe that is up to the *new* General Staff, sir."

Narrator

He stood up and walked up to my desk.

Iosef Lancea

"The situation is mostly under control but there is still work to do."

Iosef Lancea

"No, sir. The army is doing exactly as you asked. You've brought the Forces inside our borders to stabilise the situation..."

Iosef Lancea

"The powers you gave us and your previous order were very clear, Mr. President."

Iosef Lancea

"The army is doing exactly as you asked. You've brought the Forces inside our borders to stabilise the situation..."

Iosef Lancea

"Of course."

Player

"That was not my order."

Iosef Lancea

"There is no need to doubt the Forces, sir."

Player

"What about the governor?"

Karl Greiser

"Sir. All of the rebels were eliminated immediately after with zero casualties from our security forces."

Narrator

I saw a zeppelin flying over the Maroon District.
